Padanaram is a mix of great potlucks, bomb-ass parties, a lot of praying, and a hierarchy not to be messed with. episodes.title: Birds Aren't Real
episodes.description:

By which we mean they found a way to monetize it, cultify it, and really wring every bit of joy out of an otherwise pretty great thing. Come along with  us, as we enter One Taste, the commune you don't have to pack your things to join (because they'll provide the matching t-shirts and you don't need pants)...Love Cults I'd Join? episodes.title: The Latter-day Saints
episodes.description: Golden tablets, oddly communicative angels, sacred undies... We at CIJ LOVE a new religion, and the LDS church continues to evolve and find its feet a scant century-plus after its birth. Yes, they have some History with a capital H to contend with, and yes, even their current scene is... a lot at times. And no, you can't have any coffee here. Still, the LDS church has the arts of ritual and sacred setups honed to a fine science, and their members are usually some of the nicest darn people you'll meet. Settle in for our deep dive into a religious landscape like no other, and relax, you can listen in any old undies you like.  Love Cults I'd Join? Jesse is taking the back seat to learn all about Young Living from the girl who lived it (and we can only assume smelled great the whole time)... episodes.title: The Path
episodes.description: Each season we choose one fictional cult to join, and this time we're signing our lives over to The Path, a Hulu original populated entirely by super hot people with great clothes. But wait... there's more! A culty underbelly? Characters for whom Jesse is sympathetic and Ameran is not? Enlightened people doing unenlightened things (in this cult and in real life)? And that's just the beginning! Whether you've already joined The Path (aka the Myerist Movement) in your head like Jesse has, or you'll find yourself bingeing it tomorrow after listening to this episode, this one is a blast and we can't wait to share it with you! Let us know on our Facebook page whether we'll be seeing you "in The Garden," we love to know which eternities we'll be sharing with who...Love Cults I'd Join? episodes.description: Season one is a wrap and we are having SO MUCH FUN! Here's the plan: Cults I'd Join will give you 12 episodes and a bonus recap every season. episodes.title: Ruby Ridge
episodes.description: If you know about Ruby Ridge, you know two things—it is not a cult and it is not a happy ending. However, the Weaver family living at Ruby Ridge did belong to a dangerous cult that is thriving today: the church of Christian Identity. Before we talk about the group itself, we're taking the time to talk about the human face of an ugly religion and everything spins out of that space. We are also talking about government branches that have more brute force than life experience, and the long-standing clash between rule makers and rule breakers. episodes.description: Ever driven past a lovely Amish family in their buggy and thought, "Revolutionary! Outlaw! Hung in the square and burned at the stake!"
